alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; James City; Mathews; Middlesex; Newport News; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 9:13PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT GLOUCESTER...SOUTHEASTERN MIDDLESEX...NORTHWESTERN YORK...MATHEWS...AND NORTHEASTERN JAMES CITY COUNTIES...THE NORTHERN CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS AND THE CITY OF WILLIAMSBURG THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 913 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wicomico, or near Queens Lake, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gloucester Courthouse, Gloucester Point, and Hayes around 920 PM EDT. Blakes around 940 PM EDT. Deltaville around 945 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lackey, Ruff, Beulah, Moon, Camp Peary, Glass, Naxera, Harmony Village, Grafton, and Harcum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Gloucester; James City; Mathews; Middlesex; Newport News; York
